definitions.definition: To set apart or cut off from others.
To place in quarantine or isolation.
To separate a substance in pure form from a mixture.
To insulate, or make free of external influence.
To separate a pure strain of bacteria etc. from a mixed culture.
To insulate an electrical component from a source of electricity.
Placed or standing apart or alone; in isolation.
(of a pawn) Such that no pawn of the same color is in an adjacent file.
(of precipitation) affecting 10 percent to 20 percent of a forecast zone.
Which has been extracted from the organism.
One who performs surgery; a doctor who performs operations on people or animals.
definitions.example: The surgeon refused to operate because the patient was her son.

definitions.definition: A surgeonfish.

A residential area located on the outskirts of a city or large town that usually includes businesses that cater to its residents; such as schools, grocery stores, shopping centers, restaurants, convenience stores, etc.
(by extension) The outer part; the environment.
Any subdivision of a conurbation, not necessarily on the periphery.
Someone possessing extraordinary intelligence or skill; especially somebody who has demonstrated this by a creative or original work in science, music, art etc.
definitions.example: I think that would qualify as not smart, but genius... and a very stable genius at that!

definitions.definition: Extraordinary mental capacity.
Inspiration, a mental leap, an extraordinary creative process.
definitions.example: a work of genius.

definitions.definition: The tutelary deity or spirit of a place or person.
Ingenious, brilliant, very clever, or original.
definitions.example: What a genius idea!

definitions.definition: The presumed cause, force, principle, or divine will that predetermines events.
The effect, consequence, outcome, or inevitable events predetermined by this cause.
An event or a situation which is inevitable in the fullness of time.
Destiny; often with a connotation of death, ruin, misfortune, etc.
definitions.example: Accept your fate.

definitions.definition: Alternative letter-case form of Fate (one of the goddesses said to control the destiny of human beings).
To foreordain or predetermine, to make inevitable.
definitions.example: The oracle's prediction fated Oedipus to kill his father; not all his striving could change what would occur.

definitions.definition: A list of names, addresses etc, of specific classes of people or organizations, often in alphabetical order or in some classification.
A structured listing of the names and characteristics of the files on a storage device.
A virtual container in a computer's file system, in which files and other directories may be stored. The files and subdirectories in a directory are usually related.
Containing directions; instructing; directorial.
To issue a command; to tell.
definitions.example: He bade me come in.

definitions.definition: To invite; to summon.
definitions.example: She was bidden to the wedding.

definitions.definition: To utter a greeting or salutation.
To make an offer to pay or accept a certain price.
definitions.example: Have you ever bid in an auction?

definitions.definition: To offer as a price.
definitions.example: She bid £2000 for the Persian carpet.

definitions.definition: To make an attempt.
definitions.example: He was bidding for the chance to coach his team to victory once again.

definitions.definition: To announce (one's goal), before starting play.
To proclaim (a bede, prayer); to pray.
To issue a command; to tell.
definitions.example: He bade me come in.

definitions.definition: To invite; to summon.
definitions.example: She was bidden to the wedding.

definitions.definition: To utter a greeting or salutation.
An offer at an auction, or to carry out a piece of work.
definitions.example: His bid was $35,000.

definitions.definition: (ultimate frisbee) A (failed) attempt to receive or intercept a pass.
definitions.example: Nice bid!

definitions.definition: An attempt, effort, or pursuit (of a goal).
definitions.example: He put in his bid for office.

definitions.definition: To make an offer to pay or accept a certain price.
definitions.example: Have you ever bid in an auction?

definitions.definition: To offer as a price.
definitions.example: She bid £2000 for the Persian carpet.

definitions.definition: To make an attempt.
definitions.example: He was bidding for the chance to coach his team to victory once again.

definitions.definition: To announce (one's goal), before starting play.
To proclaim (a bede, prayer); to pray.
Wilderness where human development is prohibited.
A jam or thick syrup made from fruit.
A medicinal confection made of freshly gathered vegetable substances mixed with finely powdered refined sugar.
A conservatory.
To save for later use, sometimes by the use of a preservative.
definitions.example: to conserve fruits with sugar

definitions.definition: To protect an environment.
To remain unchanged during a process
Something added, especially to make up for a deficiency.
An extension to a document or publication that adds information, corrects errors or brings up to date.
An additional section of a newspaper devoted to a specific subject.
An angle that, when added to a given angle, makes 180°; a supplementary angle.
(nutrition) A vitamin, herbal extract or chemical compound ingested to meet dietary deficiencies or enhance muscular development.
An additional charge, especially for food in a restaurant.
definitions.example: There is a £2 supplement if you choose the steak.

definitions.definition: To provide or make a supplement to something.
An alphabetical listing of items and their location.
definitions.example: The index of a book lists words or expressions and the pages of the book upon which they are to be found.

definitions.definition: The index finger; the forefinger.
A movable finger on a gauge, scale, etc.
A symbol resembling a pointing hand, used to direct particular attention to a note or paragraph.
That which points out; that which shows, indicates, manifests, or discloses.
A sign; an indication; a token.

A type of noun where the meaning of the form changes with respect to the context. E.g., 'Today's newspaper' is an indexical form since its referent will differ depending on the context. See also icon and symbol.
A single number calculated from an array of prices or of quantities.
A number representing a property or ratio, a coefficient.
A raised suffix indicating a power.
An integer or other key indicating the location of data e.g. within an array, vector, database table, associative array, or hash table.
A data structure that improves the performance of operations on a table.
A prologue indicating what follows.
To arrange an index for something, especially a long text.
To inventory, to take stock.
To normalise in order to account for inflation; to correct for inflation by linking to a price index in order to maintain real levels.
To be indexical for (some situation or state of affairs); to indicate.
To access a value in a data container by an index.
The chance of suffering harm; danger, peril, risk of loss.
definitions.example: He encountered the enemy at the hazard of his reputation and life.

definitions.definition: An obstacle or other feature which causes risk or danger; originally in sports, and now applied more generally.
definitions.example: The video game involves guiding a character on a skateboard past all kinds of hazards.

definitions.definition: (in driving a vehicle) An obstacle or other feature that presents a risk or danger that justifies the driver in taking action to avoid it.
A sand or water obstacle on a golf course.
The act of potting a ball, whether the object ball (winning hazard) or the player's ball (losing hazard).
A game of chance played with dice, usually for monetary stakes; popular mainly from 14th c. to 19th c.
Chance.
Anything that is hazarded or risked, such as a stake in gambling.
The side of the court into which the ball is served.
A problem with the instruction pipeline in CPU microarchitectures when the next instruction cannot execute in the following clock cycle, potentially leading to incorrect results.
To expose to chance; to take a risk.
To risk (something); to venture, to incur, or bring on.
definitions.example: I'll hazard a guess.

definitions.definition: In a manner that is impossible to avoid or prevent.
definitions.example: Despite the town's best efforts, the dam inevitably gave way.

definitions.definition: As usual; predictably; as expected.
definitions.example: Inevitably, the next-door neighbour began to mow his lawn just as she lays down her head after a long night shift.

definitions.definition: A retinue or company of attendants, as of a distinguished personage
definitions.example: the ambassador's suite

definitions.definition: A connected series or succession of objects; a number of things used or classed together
definitions.example: a suite of minerals

definitions.definition: A group of connected rooms, usually separable from other rooms by means of access.
definitions.example: The Presidential suite is well appointed and allows for good security.

definitions.definition: A musical form, popular before the time of the sonata, consisting of a string or series of pieces all in the same key, mostly in various dance rhythms, with sometimes an elaborate prelude.

An excerpt of instrumental music from a larger work that contains other elements besides the music; for example, the Nutcracker Suite is the music (but not the dancing) from the ballet The Nutcracker, and the Carmen Suite is the instrumental music (but not the singing and dancing) from the opera Carmen.
A group of related computer programs distributed together.
An incorporeal and sometimes divine messenger from a deity, or other divine entity, often depicted in art as a youthful winged figure in flowing robes.
(Abrahamic tradition) One of the lowest order of such beings, below virtues.
A person having the qualities attributed to angels, such as purity or selflessness.
definitions.example: Thanks for making me breakfast in bed, you little angel.

definitions.definition: Attendant spirit; genius; demon.
(possibly obsolete) An official (a bishop, or sometimes a minister) who heads a Christian church, especially a Catholic Apostolic church.
An English gold coin, bearing the figure of the archangel Michael, circulated between the 15th and 17th centuries, and varying in value from six shillings and eightpence to ten shillings.
(originally Royal Air Force) An altitude, measured in thousands of feet.
definitions.example: Climb to angels sixty. (“ascend to 60,000 feet”)

definitions.definition: An unidentified flying object detected by air traffic control radar.
An affluent individual who provides capital for a startup, usually in exchange for convertible debt or ownership equity; an angel investor.
The person who funds a show.
To support by donating money.
A person who has Angelman syndrome.
The transfer of a company or organization from government to private ownership and control.
An act of complying.
The state of being compliant.
The tendency of conforming with or agreeing to the wishes of others.
A measure of the extension or displacement of a loaded structure; its flexibility
The accuracy with which a patient follows an agreed treatment plan
The department of a business that ensures all government regulations are complied with.
A vocal sound; specifically, a purely vocal element of speech, unmodified except by resonance; a vowel or a diphthong; a tonic element; a tonic; distinguished from a subvocal, and a nonvocal
(Roman Catholic Church) A man who has a right to vote in certain elections.
Of or pertaining to the voice or speech
definitions.example: vocal problems

definitions.definition: Having a voice
Uttered or modulated by the voice; oral
definitions.example: vocal melody

definitions.definition: Of or pertaining to a voice sound; spoken

Consisting of, or characterized by, voice, or tone produced in the larynx, which may be modified, either by resonance, as in the case of the vowels, or by obstructive action, as in certain consonants, such as v, l, etc., or by both, as in the nasals (m), (n), ng; sonant; intonated; voiced. See voice, and vowel
Of or pertaining to a vowel; having the character of a vowel; vowel
definitions.example: a vocal sound

definitions.definition: Loud; getting oneself heard.
definitions.example: The protesters were very vocal in their message to the mayor.

definitions.definition: A benefactor; someone who donates to charity or some cause.
definitions.example: I am a longstanding financial contributor to Amnesty International.

definitions.definition: A person who backs, supports or champions a cause, activity or institution.
definitions.example: He was a regular contributor to Greenpeace protests.

definitions.definition: A person (or thing) instrumental in the creation or growth of something.
definitions.example: With her strength and intelligence, she was an important contributor to the victorious effort.

definitions.definition: A person who produces articles published in a newspaper, magazine, online publication, etc.
definitions.example: William Safire has been a notable contributor to the op-ed pages of the New York Times for many years.

definitions.definition: Absence of order; state of not being arranged in an orderly manner.
definitions.example: After playing the children left the room in disorder.

definitions.definition: A disturbance of civic peace or of public order.
definitions.example: The army tried to prevent disorder when claims the elections had been rigged grew stronger.

definitions.definition: A physical or mental malfunction.
definitions.example: Bulimia is an eating disorder.

definitions.definition: To throw into a state of disorder.
To knock out of order or sequence.
A debate or discussion of opposing opinions; (generally) strife.
A person who does something only occasionally.
Occurring or appearing irregularly from time to time, but not often.
definitions.example: He took an occasional glass of wine.

definitions.definition: Created for a specific occasion.
definitions.example: Elgar's music was not created to be occasional music for high-school graduations.

definitions.definition: Intended for use as the occasion requires.
definitions.example: What your living room needs are some occasional chairs.

definitions.definition: Acting in the indicated role from time to time.
definitions.example: He is an occasional writer of letters to the editor.

definitions.definition: Anything that is difficult to understand or make sense of.
definitions.example: Where he went after he left the house is a puzzle.

definitions.definition: A game for one or more people that is more or less difficult to work out or complete.
A crossword puzzle.
A jigsaw puzzle.
A riddle.
Something made with marvellous skill; something of ingenious construction.
The state of being puzzled; perplexity.
definitions.example: to be in a puzzle

definitions.definition: To perplex (someone).
To think long and carefully, in bewilderment.
definitions.example: We puzzled over the curious-shaped lock, but were unable to discover how the key should be inserted.

definitions.definition: To make intricate; to entangle.
Made-up, false, imaginary, fabricated.
Of or relating to a reconciliation.
definitions.example: Joe and Joanne had a big fight, and then apologized and had incredible make-up sex.

definitions.definition: An item's composition.
definitions.example: To understand how a nuclear reactor works, we must first look at its makeup.

definitions.definition: Cosmetics; colorants and other substances applied to the skin to alter its appearance.
definitions.example: She is wearing a lot of makeup.

definitions.definition: Replacement; material used to make up for the amount that has been used up.
A test given to students allowing them to repeat failed material.
(within a machine or machinery) Any mechanical means for the conversion or control of motion, or the transmission or control of power.
Any combination of cams, gears, links, belts, chains and logical mechanical elements.
A group of entities, such as objects, that interact together.
definitions.example: political machine

definitions.definition: A mental, physical or chemical process.
Any process of, or system designed to manage useful energy conversion.
The theory that all natural phenomena can be explained by physical causes.
A very short period of time; a moment.
definitions.example: She paused for only an instant, which was just enough time for John to change the subject.

definitions.definition: A single, usually precise, point in time.
definitions.example: The instant the alarm went off, he fled the building.

definitions.definition: A beverage or food which has been pre-processed to reduce preparation time, especially instant coffee.
A camera that uses self-developing film to create a chemically developed print shortly after the photograph is taken.
Impending; imminent.
Urgent; pressing; acute.
Insistent; persistent.
Present; current; extant.
Occurring immediately; immediate; present.
Lasting for a short moment; momentary; short-lived.
Very quickly and easily prepared.
definitions.example: instant coffee; instant noodles; instant mashed potato; instant photo

definitions.definition: Of the current month.
definitions.example: I refer to your letter of the 16th instant in regard to traffic disruption.

definitions.definition: At once; immediately.
A dramatic gesture such as the waving of a flag.
definitions.example: With many flourishes of the captured banner, they marched down the avenue.

definitions.definition: An ornamentation.
definitions.example: His signature ended with a flourish.

definitions.definition: A ceremonious passage such as a fanfare.
definitions.example: The trumpets blew a flourish as they entered the church.

definitions.definition: A decorative embellishment on a building.
To thrive or grow well.
definitions.example: The barley flourished in the warm weather.

definitions.definition: To prosper or fare well.
definitions.example: The cooperation flourished as the customers rushed in the business.

definitions.definition: To be in a period of greatest influence.
definitions.example: His writing flourished before the war.

definitions.definition: To develop; to make thrive; to expand.
To make bold, sweeping movements with.
definitions.example: They flourished the banner as they stormed the palace.

definitions.definition: To make bold and sweeping, fanciful, or wanton movements, by way of ornament, parade, bravado, etc.; to play with fantastic and irregular motion.
To use florid language; to indulge in rhetorical figures and lofty expressions.
To make ornamental strokes with the pen; to write graceful, decorative figures.
To adorn with beautiful figures or rhetoric; to ornament with anything showy; to embellish.
To execute an irregular or fanciful strain of music, by way of ornament or prelude.
To boast; to vaunt; to brag.
A large or disorderly group of people; especially one bent on riotous or destructive action.
A group of animals such as horses or cattle.
A flock of emus.
The Mafia, or a similar group that engages in organized crime (preceded by the).
A non-player character, especially one that exists to be fought or killed to further the progression of the story or game.
The lower classes of a community; the rabble.
(Australian Aboriginal) A group of Aboriginal people associated with an extended family group, clan group or wider community group, from a particular place or country.
To crowd around (someone), sometimes with hostility.
definitions.example: The fans mobbed a well-dressed couple who resembled their idols.

definitions.definition: To crowd into or around a place.
definitions.example: The shoppers mobbed the store on the first day of the sale.

definitions.definition: A promiscuous woman; a harlot or wench; a prostitute.
A mob cap.
To wrap up in, or cover with, a cowl.
Mobile phone
A state of progression from one place to another.
A change of position with respect to time.
A change from one place to another.
A parliamentary action to propose something. A similar procedure in any official or business meeting.
definitions.example: The motion to amend is now open for discussion.

definitions.definition: An entertainment or show, especially a puppet show.
From κίνησις (kinesis); any change. Traditionally of four types: generation and corruption, alteration, augmentation and diminution, and change of place.
Movement of the mind, desires, or passions; mental act, or impulse to any action; internal activity.
A formal request, oral or written, made to a judge or court of law to obtain an official court ruling or order for a legal action to be taken by, or on behalf of, the movant.
A movement of the bowels; the product of such movement.

Change of pitch in successive sounds, whether in the same part or in groups of parts. (Conjunct motion is that by single degrees of the scale. Contrary motion is when parts move in opposite directions. Disjunct motion is motion by skips. Oblique motion is when one part is stationary while another moves. Similar or direct motion is when parts move in the same direction.)
A puppet, or puppet show.
A piece of moving mechanism, such as on a steam locomotive.
To gesture indicating a desired movement.
definitions.example: He motioned for me to come closer.

definitions.definition: To introduce a motion in parliamentary procedure.
To make a proposal; to offer plans.
A storage closet either separate from, or built into, a wall.
A cupboard.
The upright assembly that houses a coin-operated arcade game, a cab.
A size of photograph, specifically one measuring 3⅞" by 5½".
A group of advisors to a government or business entity.

(often capitalized) In parliamentary and some other systems of government, the group of ministers responsible for creating government policy and for overseeing the departments comprising the executive branch.
A small chamber or private room.
(often capitalized) A collection of art or ethnographic objects.
(Rhode Island) Milkshake.
A hut; a cottage; a small house.
An enclosure for mechanical or electrical equipment.
To start criminal proceedings against.
definitions.example: to prosecute a man for trespass, or for a riot

definitions.definition: To charge, try.
To seek to obtain by legal process.
definitions.example: to prosecute a right or a claim in a court of law

definitions.definition: To pursue something to the end.
definitions.example: to prosecute a scheme, hope, or claim

definitions.definition: The quality of being patient.
Any of various card games that can be played by one person. Called solitaire in the US. (card game).
A revolutionist; a person who revolts.
, Chopin's 'Revolutionary Etude' Op. 10 no. 12
Of or pertaining to a revolution in government; tending to, or promoting, revolution
definitions.example: revolutionary agitators

definitions.definition: Pertaining to something that portends of great change; overthrowing a standing mindset
definitions.example: a revolutionary new tool

definitions.definition: Pertaining to something that revolves
To enter (a name, etc.) in a register, roll or list
To enlist (someone) or make (someone) a member of
definitions.example: They were eager to enroll new recruits.

definitions.definition: To enlist oneself (in something) or become a member (of something)
definitions.example: Have you enrolled in classes yet for this term?

definitions.definition: To envelop; to enwrap.

Fixtures, equipment, tools and devices used for general-purpose construction and repair of a structure or object. Also such equipment as sold as stock by a store of the same name, e.g. hardware store.
Equipment.
definitions.example: military hardware

definitions.definition: The part of a computer that is fixed and cannot be altered without replacement or physical modification; motherboard, expansion cards, etc. Compare software.
Electronic equipment.
Metal implements.
A firearm.
The function or duty of an ambassador.
An organization or group of officials who permanently represent a sovereign state in a second sovereign state or with respect to an international organization such as the United Nations.
definitions.example: The American embassy to France is located in Paris.

definitions.definition: A temporary mission representing a sovereign state.
The official residence of such a group, or of an ambassador.
Aromatic or pungent plant matter (usually dried) used to season or flavour food.
Appeal, interest; an attribute that makes something appealing, interesting, or engaging.
A synthetic cannabinoid drug.
Sweets, candy.
Species; kind.
A characteristic touch or taste; smack; flavour.
An aromatic odour.
To add spice or spices to; season.
To spice up.
The chief executive officer of a first-level division of a country.
A device which regulates or controls some action of a machine through automatic feedback.

A member of a decision-making for an organization or entity (including some public agencies) similar to or equivalent to a board of directors (used especially for banks); a member of the board of governors.
Father.
Boss, employer, similar to gaffer.
Term of address to a man; guv'nor.
(grammar) A constituent of a phrase that governs another.
One who has the care or guardianship of a young man; a tutor; a guardian.
A pilot; a steersman.
A person belonging to a province; one who is provincial.
A monastic superior, who, under the general of his order, has the direction of all the religious houses of the same fraternity in a given district, called a province of the order.
A country bumpkin.
Of or pertaining to a province.
definitions.example: a provincial dialect

definitions.definition: Constituting a province.
Exhibiting the ways or manners of a province; characteristic of the inhabitants of a province.
Not cosmopolitan; backwoodsy, hick, yokelish, countrified; not polished; rude
Narrow; illiberal.
Of or pertaining to an ecclesiastical province, or to the jurisdiction of an archbishop; not ecumenical.
definitions.example: a provincial synod

definitions.definition: Limited in outlook; narrow.
A place or institution for the confinement of persons held in lawful custody or detention, especially for minor offenses or with reference to some future judicial proceeding.
Confinement in a jail.
The condition created by the requirement that a horse claimed in a claiming race not be run at another track for some period of time (usually 30 days).
In dodgeball and related games, the area where players who have been struck by the ball are confined.
(FreeBSD) A kind of sandbox for running a guest operating system instance.
To imprison.
The state of being hostile.
definitions.example: My resentment and anger towards you caused hostility and a division between us.

definitions.definition: A hostile action, especially a military action. See hostilities for specific plural definition.
A legal sentence.
definitions.example: The penalty for his crime was to do hard labor.

definitions.definition: A punishment for violating rules of procedure.
A payment forfeited for an early withdrawal from an account or an investment.
A direct free kick from the penalty spot, taken after a defensive foul in the penalty box; a penalty kick.
A punishment for an infraction of the rules, often in the form of being removed from play for a specified amount of time.
definitions.example: A penalty was called when he tripped up his opponent.

definitions.definition: A vista or point that gives a beautiful view.
To offer a view (of something) from a higher position.
definitions.example: Our hotel room overlooks the lake.

definitions.definition: To fail to notice; to look over and beyond (anything) without seeing it.
definitions.example: These errors were overlooked by the proofreaders.

definitions.definition: To pretend not to have noticed (something, especially a mistake or flaw); to pass over (something) without censure or punishment.
definitions.example: I’m not willing to overlook such bad behaviour.

definitions.definition: To look down upon (something) from a place that is over or above.
definitions.example: to overlook a valley from a hill

definitions.definition: To supervise, oversee; to watch over.
definitions.example: to overlook a gang of laborers

definitions.definition: To observe or watch (someone or something) surreptitiously or secretly.
To inspect (something); to examine; to look over carefully or repeatedly.
To look upon with an evil eye; to bewitch by looking upon; to fascinate.
In a severe manner.
A person who or thing that collects, or which creates or manages a collection.
definitions.example: He is an avid collector of nineteenth-century postage stamps.

definitions.definition: A person who is employed to collect payments.
definitions.example: She works for the government as a tax collector.

definitions.definition: The amplified terminal on a bipolar junction transistor.
A compiler of books; one who collects scattered passages and puts them together in one book.
One holding a Bachelor of Arts in Oxford, formerly appointed to superintend some scholastic proceedings in Lent.
A major sewer which collects sewerage from a number of smaller branch sewers
A mafioso whose task is to collect protection money from small businesses
Originally, a stick; now specifically, a long and slender piece of metal or (especially) wood, used for various construction or support purposes.
A type of basic fishing rod.
A long sports implement used for pole-vaulting; now made of glassfiber or carbon fiber, formerly also metal, bamboo and wood have been used.
(spotting) A telescope used to identify birds, aeroplanes or wildlife.
A unit of length, equal to a rod (1/4 chain or 5 1/2 yards).
Pole position.
A gun.
A penis
To propel by pushing with poles, to push with a pole.
definitions.example: Huck Finn poled that raft southward down the Mississippi because going northward against the current was too much work.

definitions.definition: To identify something quite precisely using a telescope.
definitions.example: He poled off the serial of the Gulfstream to confirm its identity.

definitions.definition: To furnish with poles for support.
definitions.example: to pole beans or hops

definitions.definition: To convey on poles.
definitions.example: to pole hay into a barn

definitions.definition: To stir, as molten glass, with a pole.
To strike (the ball) very hard.
Either of the two points on the earth's surface around which it rotates; also, similar points on any other rotating object.
A point of magnetic focus, especially each of the two opposing such points of a magnet (designated north and south).
A fixed point relative to other points or lines.
A contact on an electrical device (such as a battery) at which electric current enters or leaves.
For a meromorphic function f(z), any point a for which f(z) \rightarrow \infty as z \rightarrow a.
definitions.example: The function f(z) = \frac{1}{z-3} has a single pole at z = 3

definitions.definition: The firmament; the sky.
Either of the states that characterize a bipolar disorder.
To induce piezoelectricity in (a substance) by aligning the dipoles.
One who gives or causes offense, or does something wrong.
A person who commits an offense against the law, a lawbreaker.
A company, business, organization, or other purposeful endeavor.
definitions.example: A micro-enterprise is defined as a business having 5 or fewer employees and a low seed capital.

definitions.definition: An undertaking, venture, or project, especially a daring and courageous one.
definitions.example: Biosphere 2 was a scientific enterprise aimed at the exploration of the complex web of interactions within life systems.

definitions.definition: A willingness to undertake new or risky projects; energy and initiative.
definitions.example: He has shown great enterprise throughout his early career.

definitions.definition: Active participation in projects.
To undertake an enterprise, or something hazardous or difficult.
To undertake; to begin and attempt to perform; to venture upon.
To treat with hospitality; to entertain.
An act of putting arms around someone and bringing the person close to the chest; a hug.
An enclosure partially or fully surrounding someone or something.
Full acceptance (of something).
An act of enfolding or including.
To clasp (someone or each other) in the arms with affection; to take in the arms; to hug.
To seize (something) eagerly or with alacrity; to accept or take up with cordiality; to welcome.
definitions.example: I wholeheartedly embrace the new legislation.

definitions.definition: To submit to; to undergo.
To encircle; to enclose, to encompass.
To enfold, to include (ideas, principles, etc.); to encompass.
definitions.example: Natural philosophy embraces many sciences.

definitions.definition: To fasten on, as armour.
To accept (someone) as a friend; to accept (someone's) help gladly.
To attempt to influence (a court, jury, etc.) corruptly; to practise embracery.
The quality or state of being necessary, unavoidable, or absolutely requisite.
definitions.example: I bought a new table out of necessity. My old one was ruined.

definitions.definition: The condition of being needy; desperate need; lack
Something necessary; a requisite; something indispensable.
definitions.example: A tent is a necessity if you plan on camping.

definitions.definition: Something which makes an act or an event unavoidable; an irresistible force; overruling power
The negation of freedom in voluntary action; the subjection of all phenomena, whether material or spiritual, to inevitable causation; necessitarianism.
Greater utilitarian good; used in justification of a criminal act.
definitions.example: doctrine of necessity

definitions.definition: (in the plural) Indispensable requirements (of life).
A replacement or stand-in for something that achieves a similar result or purpose.
A player who is available to replace another if the need arises, and who may or may not actually do so.
One who enlists for military service in the place of a conscript.
To use in place of something else, with the same function.
definitions.example: I had no shallots so I substituted onion.

definitions.definition: (in the phrase "substitute X for Y") To use X in place of Y.
definitions.example: I had to substitute new parts for the old ones.

definitions.definition: (in the phrase "substitute X with/by Y") To use Y in place of X; to replace X with Y.
definitions.example: I had to substitute old parts with the new ones.

definitions.definition: To remove (a player) from the field of play and bring on another in his place.
definitions.example: He was playing poorly and was substituted after twenty minutes

definitions.definition: To serve as a replacement (for someone or something).
A good that a consumer perceives as similar to another good, which decreases the demand for that other good
A room or set of rooms, particularly:
A chamberpot.
The legislature or division of the legislature itself.
definitions.example: The resolution, which speedily passed the Senate, was unable to gain a majority in the lower chamber.

definitions.definition: Any enclosed space occupying or similar to a room.
definitions.example: A canal lock chamber; a furnace chamber; a test chamber

definitions.definition: An enlarged space in an underground tunnel of a burrowing animal.
The area holding the ammunition round at the initiation of its discharge.
definitions.example: Dianne loaded a cartridge into the chamber of the rifle, then prepared to take aim at the target.

definitions.definition: One of the bullet-holding compartments in the cylinder of a revolver.
A short piece of ordnance or cannon which stood on its breech without any carriage, formerly used chiefly for celebrations and theatrical cannonades.
One of the two atria or two ventricles of the heart.
To enclose in a room.
definitions.example: She had chambered herself in her room, and wouldn't come out.

definitions.definition: To reside in or occupy a chamber or chambers.
To place in a chamber, as a round of ammunition.
definitions.example: The hunter fired at the geese and missed, then shrugged his shoulders and chambered another cartridge.

definitions.definition: To create or modify a gun to be a specific caliber.
definitions.example: The rifle was originally chambered for 9mm, but had since been modified for a larger, wildcat caliber.

definitions.definition: In martial arts, to prepare an offensive, defensive, or counteroffensive action by drawing a limb or weapon to a position where it may be charged with kinetic energy.
definitions.example: Bob chambered his fist for a blow, but Sheila struck first.

definitions.definition: To be lascivious.
A container used for urination and defecation, particularly those used in early modern towns before the advent of the flush toilet.

A military action consisting of armed forces of one geopolitical entity entering territory controlled by another such entity, generally with the objective of conquering territory or altering the established government.
The entry without consent of an individual or group into an area where they are not wanted.
definitions.example: an invasion of bees

definitions.definition: The spread of cancer cells, bacteries and such to the organism.
The breaching of the skin barrier.
The formation of something complex or coherent by combining simpler things.
The reaction of elements or compounds to form more complex compounds.
A deduction from the general to the particular.
The combination of thesis and antithesis.
In intelligence usage, the examining and combining of processed information with other information and intelligence for final interpretation.
An apt arrangement of elements of a text, especially for euphony.
(grammar) The uniting of ideas into a sentence.
The reunion of parts that have been divided.
Relating to or composed of electors.
Of, or relating to elections.
An animal of the subkingdom Articulata.
Clear; effective.
Speaking in a clear and effective manner.
definitions.example: She’s a bright, articulate young woman.

definitions.definition: Consisting of segments united by joints.
definitions.example: The robot arm was articulate in two directions.

definitions.definition: Distinctly marked off.
definitions.example: an articulate period in history

definitions.definition: Expressed in articles or in separate items or particulars.
(of sound) Related to human speech, as distinct from the vocalisation of animals.
To make clear or effective.
To speak clearly; to enunciate.
definitions.example: I wish he’d articulate his words more clearly.

definitions.definition: To explain; to put into words; to make something specific.
definitions.example: I like this painting, but I can’t articulate why.

definitions.definition: To bend or hinge something at intervals, or to allow or build something so that it can bend.
definitions.example: an articulated bus

definitions.definition: To attack a note, as by tonguing, slurring, bowing, etc.
definitions.example: Articulate that passage heavily.

definitions.definition: To form a joint or connect by joints
definitions.example: The lower jaw articulates with the skull at the temporomandibular joint.

definitions.definition: To treat or make terms.
An item of goods or supplies, especially food, obtained for future use.
The act of providing, or making previous preparation.
Money set aside for a future event.
A liability or contra account to recognise likely future adverse events associated with current transactions.
definitions.example: We increased our provision for bad debts on credit sales going into the recession.

definitions.definition: A clause in a legal instrument, a law, etc., providing for a particular matter; stipulation; proviso.
definitions.example: An arrest shall be made in accordance with the provisions of this Act.

definitions.definition: Regular induction into a benefice, comprehending nomination, collation, and installation.
A nomination by the pope to a benefice before it became vacant, depriving the patron of his right of presentation.
To supply with provisions.
definitions.example: to provision an army

definitions.definition: To supply (a user) with an account, resources, etc. so that they can use a system.
A small, usually round or cylindrical object designed for easy swallowing, usually containing some sort of medication.
(definite, i.e. used with "the") Contraceptive medication, usually in the form of a pill to be taken by a woman; an oral contraceptive pill.
definitions.example: Jane went on the pill when she left for college.

definitions.definition: A comical or entertaining person.
A contemptible, annoying, or unpleasant person.
A small piece of any substance, for example a ball of fibres formed on the surface of a textile by rubbing.
A baseball.
A bullet (projectile).
A rounded rectangle indicating the tag or category that an item belongs to.
Of a woven fabric surface, to form small matted balls of fiber.
To form into the shape of a pill.
definitions.example: Pilling is a skill rarely used by modern pharmacists.

definitions.definition: To medicate with pills.
definitions.example: She pills herself with all sorts of herbal medicines.

definitions.definition: To persuade or convince someone of something.
The peel or skin.
To peel; to remove the outer layer of hair, skin, or bark.
To peel; to make by removing the skin.
To be peeled; to peel off in flakes.
To pillage; to despoil or impoverish.
An inlet on the coast; a small tidal pool or bay.
A book in which notes or memoranda are written.
Short for notebook computer.
The act or process of regaining or repossession of something lost.
A return to normal health.
A return to former status or position.
Renewed growth after a slump.
A verdict giving somebody the right to recover debts or costs.
The extraction of an ore from a mine, or of a metal from an ore
The ability to recover or regain health.
A group of three people or things.
A group of three musicians.
A piece of music written for three musicians.
A passage in the middle of a minuet, frequently in a different key.
Any cocktail made with a spirit, a liqueur, and a creamy ingredient.
A person of higher rank or quality.
The senior person in a monastic community.
The head of certain churches and colleges.
One who has made an original grant of heritable property to a tenant or vassal, on condition of a certain annual payment (feu duty) or of the performance of certain services.
Higher in quality.
definitions.example: Rebecca had always thought shorts were far superior to pants, as they didn't constantly make her legs itch.

definitions.definition: Higher in rank.
More comprehensive, as a term in classification.
definitions.example: A genus is superior to a species.

definitions.definition: Located above.
definitions.example: the superior jaw; the superior part of an image

definitions.definition: Greater or better than average; extraordinary.
Beyond the power or influence of; too great or firm to be subdued or affected by; with to.
Of a planet: closer to the Earth than to the sun.
A vertex or zenith.
A vertical geometrical figure; a perpendicular.
An individual slat in a set of vertical blinds.
A vertical component of a structure.
A vertical market.
definitions.example: We offer specialised accounting software targeting various verticals.

definitions.definition: Standing, pointing, or moving straight up or down; along the direction of a plumb line; perpendicular to something horizontal.
In a two-dimensional Cartesian co-ordinate system, describing the axis y oriented normal (perpendicular, at right angles) to the horizontal axis x.
In a three-dimensional co-ordinate system, describing the axis z oriented normal (perpendicular, orthogonal) to the basic plane xy.
Of or pertaining to vertical markets.
(wine tasting) Involving different vintages of the same wine type from the same winery.
Of an interval: having the two notes sound simultaneously.
Demonstrating thought or careful consideration.
definitions.example: Most thoughtful people eventually solve the puzzle.

definitions.definition: Demonstrating kindness or consideration for others.
definitions.example: Preparing dinner is a thoughtful gesture for a new mother.

definitions.definition: A room, especially one which is not particularly large, used for manufacturing or other light industrial work.
A brief, intensive course of education for a small group, emphasizing interaction and practical problem solving.
An academic conference.
To help a playwright revise a draft of (a play) by rehearsing it with actors and critiquing the results.
To work on or revise something, especially collaboratively, in a workshop.
To improve through collaboration.
The state of being allied.
definitions.example: matrimonial alliances; an alliance between church and state, or between two countries

definitions.definition: The act of allying or uniting.
A union or connection of interests between families, states, parties, etc., especially between families by marriage and states by compact, treaty, or league.
Any union resembling that of families or states; union by relationship in qualities; affinity.
(with the definite article) The persons or parties allied.
To connect or unite by alliance; to ally.
A form of film punctuation in which there is a gradual transition from one scene to the next
To terminate a union of multiple members actively, as by disbanding.
definitions.example: The ruling party or coalition sometimes dissolves parliament early when the polls are favorable, hoping to reconvene with a larger majority.

definitions.definition: To destroy, make disappear.
To liquify, melt into a fluid.
To be melted, changed into a fluid.
To disintegrate chemically into a solution by immersion into a liquid or gas.
To be disintegrated by such immersion.
To disperse, drive apart a group of persons.
To break the continuity of; to disconnect; to loosen; to undo; to separate.
To annul; to rescind; to discharge or release.
definitions.example: to dissolve an injunction

definitions.definition: To shift from one shot to another by having the former fade out as the latter fades in.
To resolve itself as by dissolution.
To solve; to clear up; to resolve.
To relax by pleasure; to make powerless.
Recently; not long ago; of late.
To substantiate or prove the truth of something
To confirm or test the truth or accuracy of something
To affirm something formally, under oath
A delicate item of clothing, especially underwear or lingerie.
definitions.example: Don't put that in with your jeans: it's a delicate!

definitions.definition: A choice dainty; a delicacy.
A delicate, luxurious, or effeminate person.
Easily damaged or requiring careful handling.
definitions.example: The negotiations were very delicate.

definitions.definition: Characterized by a fine structure or thin lines.
definitions.example: Her face was delicate.

definitions.definition: Intended for use with fragile items.
definitions.example: Set the washing machine to the delicate cycle.

definitions.definition: Refined; gentle; scrupulous not to trespass or offend; considerate; said of manners, conduct, or feelings.
definitions.example: delicate attentions

definitions.definition: Of weak health; easily sick; unable to endure hardship.
definitions.example: a delicate child

definitions.definition: Unwell, especially because of having drunk too much alcohol.
definitions.example: Please don't speak so loudly: I'm feeling a bit delicate this morning.

definitions.definition: Addicted to pleasure; luxurious; voluptuous; alluring.
Pleasing to the senses; refined; adapted to please an elegant or cultivated taste.
definitions.example: a delicate dish

definitions.definition: Slight and shapely; lovely; graceful.
Light, or softly tinted; said of a colour.
definitions.example: a delicate shade of blue

definitions.definition: Of exacting tastes and habits; dainty; fastidious.
Highly discriminating or perceptive; refinedly critical; sensitive; exquisite.
definitions.example: a delicate ear for music

definitions.definition: Affected by slight causes; showing slight changes.
definitions.example: a delicate thermometer

definitions.definition: A partial derivative: a derivative with respect to one independent variable of a function in multiple variables while holding the other variables constant.
Any of the sine waves which make up a complex tone; often an overtone or harmonic of the fundamental.
Dentures that replace only some of the natural teeth
(forensics) An incomplete fingerprint
A fragment of a template containing markup.
To take the partial regression coefficient.
Existing as a part or portion; incomplete
definitions.example: So far, I have only pieced together a partial account of the incident.

definitions.definition: Describing a property that holds only when an algorithm terminates
definitions.example: It's easy to prove partial correctness, but it's not obvious that it is also totally correct.

definitions.definition: Biased in favor of a person, side, or point of view, especially when dealing with a competition or dispute
definitions.example: The referee is blatantly partial!

definitions.definition: (followed by the preposition to) having a predilection for something
Of or relating to a partial derivative or partial differential
Subordinate
A single aspect of a given thing.
A measure of spatial extent in a particular direction, such as height, width or breadth, or depth.
A construct whereby objects or individuals can be distinguished.
The number of independent coordinates needed to specify uniquely the location of a point in a space; also, any of such independent coordinates.
The number of elements of any basis of a vector space.
One of the physical properties that are regarded as fundamental measures of a physical quantity, such as mass, length and time.
definitions.example: The dimension of velocity is length divided by time.

definitions.definition: Any of the independent ranges of indices in a multidimensional array.
A universe or plane of existence.
To mark, cut or shape something to specified dimensions.
The transportation of goods.
The body of ships belonging to one nation, port or industry.
Passage or transport on a ship.
The cost of sending an item or package via postal services.
definitions.example: The shipping' is included in the quoted price.

definitions.definition: Navigation.
To send by water-borne transport.
To send (a parcel or container) to a recipient (by any means of transport).
definitions.example: to ship freight by railroad

definitions.definition: To release a product to vendors; to launch.
definitions.example: Our next issue ships early next year.

definitions.definition: To engage to serve on board a vessel.
definitions.example: I shipped on a man-of-war.

definitions.definition: To embark on a ship.
To put in its place.
definitions.example: to ship the tiller or rudder

definitions.definition: To take in (water) over the sides of a vessel.
definitions.example: We were shipping so much water I was sure we would capsize.

definitions.definition: To pass (from one person to another).
definitions.example: Can you ship me the ketchup?

definitions.definition: To go all in.
To trade or send a player to another team.
definitions.example: Twins ship Delmon Young to Tigers.

definitions.definition: To bungle a kick and give the opposing team possession.
To support or approve of a fictional romantic relationship between two characters, either real or themselves fictional, typically in fan fiction.
definitions.example: I ship Kirk and Spock in “Star Trek”.

definitions.definition: A theatrical work, combining drama, music, song and sometimes dance.
The score for such a work.
A building designed for the performance of such works; an opera house.
A company dedicated to performing such works.
(by extension) Any showy, melodramatic or unrealistic production resembling an opera.
A work of music or set of works with a specified rank in an ordering of a composer's complete published works.
definitions.example: Beethoven's opus eighteen quartets are considered by many to be the beginning of the Romantic era.

definitions.definition: A work, especially of art.
definitions.example: The painter's last opus was a dedication to all things living, in a surprising contrast to all of his prior work.

definitions.definition: Production; quantity produced, created, or completed.
definitions.example: The factory increased its output this year.

definitions.definition: Data sent out of the computer, as to output device such as a monitor or printer, or data sent from one program on the computer to another.
definitions.example: a six-page output; six pages of output

definitions.definition: The flow rate of body liquids such as blood and urine.
To produce, create, or complete.
definitions.example: We output 1400 units last year.

definitions.definition: To send data out of a computer, as to an output device such as a monitor or printer, or to send data from one program on the computer to another.
definitions.example: When I hit enter, it outputs a bunch of numbers.

definitions.definition: One who investigates.
The bottom-most part of a doorway that one crosses to enter; a sill.
(by extension) An entrance; the door or gate of a house.
(by extension) Any end or boundary.
The outset of something; the point of entry, or the beginning of an action.
The start of the landing area of a runway.
The quantitative point at which an action is triggered, especially a lower limit.
The wage or salary at which income tax becomes due.
The point where one mentally or physically is vulnerable in response to provocation or to particular things in general. As in emotions, stress, or pain.
A manual worker; a labourer or artisan.
Someone who builds or repairs machinery, a technician; now specifically, someone who works with and repairs the mechanical parts of a motor vehicle, aircraft or similar.
A device, command, or feature which allows someone to achieve a specific task.
definitions.example: This game has a mechanic where if you run toward a ledge you automatically jump off rather than just falling.

definitions.definition: A hit man.
Mechanical; relating to the laws of motion in the art of constructing things
Of or relating to a mechanic or artificer, or to the class of artisans; hence, rude; common; vulgar; base.
To make corrupt; to change from good to bad; to draw away from the right path; to deprave; to pervert.
To become putrid, tainted, or otherwise impure; to putrefy; to rot.
To debase or make impure by alterations or additions; to falsify.
definitions.example: to corrupt a book

definitions.definition: To waste, spoil, or consume; to make worthless.
In a depraved state; debased; perverted; morally degenerate; weak in morals.
definitions.example: The government here is corrupt, so we'll emigrate to escape them.

definitions.definition: Abounding in errors; not genuine or correct; in an invalid state.
definitions.example: It turned out that the program was corrupt - that's why it wouldn't open.

definitions.definition: In a putrid state; spoiled; tainted; vitiated; unsound.
(used in street names) A road, street, or similar thoroughfare.
A narrow passageway between fences, walls, hedges or trees.
A narrow road, as in the country.
A lengthwise division of roadway intended for a single line of vehicles.
A similar division of a racetrack to keep runners apart.
A course designated for ships or aircrafts.
An elongated wooden strip of floor along which a bowling ball is rolled.
An empty space in the tableau, formed by the removal of an entire row of cards.
Any of the parallel slots in which values can be stored in a SIMD architecture.
In MOBA (multiplayer online battle arena) games, a particular path on the map that may be traversed by enemy characters.
The homestretch.
definitions.example: And it's Uncle Mo in front by two as they come to the top of the lane.

definitions.definition: A beam of light or radiation.
definitions.example: I saw a ray of light through the clouds.

definitions.definition: A rib-like reinforcement of bone or cartilage in a fish's fin.
One of the spheromeres of a radiate, especially one of the arms of a starfish or an ophiuran.
A radiating part of a flower or plant; the marginal florets of a compound flower, such as an aster or a sunflower; one of the pedicels of an umbel or other circular flower cluster; radius.
Sight; perception; vision; from an old theory of vision, that sight was something which proceeded from the eye to the object seen.
A line extending indefinitely in one direction from a point.
A tiny amount.
definitions.example: Unfortunately he didn't have a ray of hope.

definitions.definition: To emit something as if in rays.
To radiate as if in rays.
A marine fish with a flat body, large wing-like fins, and a whip-like tail.
Array; order; arrangement; dress.
To arrange.
To dress, array (someone).
To stain or soil; to defile.
The letter ⟨/⟩, one of two which represent the r sound in Pitman shorthand.
A syllable used in solfège to represent the second note of a major scale.
To make a declaration, or give evidence, under oath.
To make a statement based on personal knowledge or faith.
An English unit of land area (symbol: a. or ac.) originally denoting a day's plowing for a yoke of oxen, now standardized as 4,840 square yards or 4,046.86 square meters.
Any of various similar units of area in other systems.
(usually in the plural) A wide expanse.
definitions.example: I like my new house - there’s acres of space!

definitions.definition: (usually in the plural) A large quantity.
A field.
The acre's breadth by the length, English units of length equal to the statute dimensions of the acre: 22 yds (≈20 m) by 220 yds (≈200 m).
A duel fought between individual Scots and Englishmen in the borderlands.
To bring up to maturity, as offspring; to educate; to instruct; to foster.
(said of people towards animals) To breed and raise.
definitions.example: The family has been rearing cattle for 200 years.

definitions.definition: To rise up on the hind legs
definitions.example: The horse was shocked, and thus reared.

definitions.definition: (usually with "up") To get angry.
To rise high above, tower above.
To raise physically or metaphorically; to lift up; to cause to rise, to elevate.
definitions.example: The monster slowly reared its head.

definitions.definition: To construct by building; to set up
definitions.example: to rear defenses or houses

definitions.definition: To raise spiritually; to lift up; to elevate morally.
To lift and take up.
To rouse; to strip up.
To move; stir.
(of geese) To carve.
definitions.example: Rere that goose!

definitions.definition: (regional, obsolete) To revive, bring to life, quicken. (only in the phrase, to rear to life)
definitions.example: He healeth the blind and he reareth to life the dead.

definitions.definition: (of eggs) Underdone; nearly raw.
(of meats) Rare.
The back or hindmost part; that which is behind, or last on order; - opposed to front.
Specifically, the part of an army or fleet which comes last, or is stationed behind the rest.
The buttocks, a creature's bottom
To place in the rear; to secure the rear of.
To sodomize (perform anal sex)
Being behind, or in the hindmost part; hindmost
definitions.example: sit in the rear seats of a car

definitions.definition: Early; soon
Fully developed; grown up in terms of physical appearance, behaviour or thinking; ripe.
definitions.example: She is quite mature for her age.

definitions.definition: Brought to a state of complete readiness.
definitions.example: a mature plan

definitions.definition: Profound; careful.
definitions.example: The headmaster decided to expel the boy after a mature consideration.

definitions.definition: Come to, or in a state of, completed suppuration.
Suitable for adults only, due to sexual themes, violence, etc.
definitions.example: mature content

definitions.definition: To proceed toward maturity: full development or completion (either of concrete or of abstract things, e.g. plans, judgments, qualities).
(of food, especially fruit) To attain maturity, to become mature or ripe.
To bring (something) to maturity, full development or completion.
To make (something, e.g. fruit) ripe or mature.
(of a person) To proceed toward or become mature or full-grown, either physically or psychologically; to gain experience or wisdom with age.
To make (someone) mature.
To reach the date when payment is due.
An estimation of a future condition.
(betting) exacta
To estimate how something will be in the future.
definitions.example: to forecast a rise in prices

definitions.definition: To foreshadow; to suggest something in advance.
To contrive or plan beforehand.
Any of the flying mammals of the order Chiroptera, usually small and nocturnal, insectivorous or frugivorous.
An old woman.
A club made of wood or aluminium used for striking the ball in sports such as baseball, softball and cricket.
A turn at hitting the ball with a bat in a game.
definitions.example: You've been in for ages. Can I have a bat now?

definitions.definition: The piece of wood on which the spinner places the coins and then uses for throwing them.
Shale or bituminous shale.
A sheet of cotton used for filling quilts or comfortables; batting.
A part of a brick with one whole end.
A stroke; a sharp blow.
A stroke of work.
Rate of motion; speed.
A spree; a jollification.
Manner; rate; condition; state of health.
To hit with a bat or (figuratively) as if with a bat.
definitions.example: He batted the ball away with a satisfying thwack.

definitions.definition: To take a turn at hitting a ball with a bat in sports like cricket, baseball and softball, as opposed to fielding.
To strike or swipe as though with a bat.
definitions.example: The cat batted at the toy.

definitions.definition: To flutter
definitions.example: bat one's eyelashes

definitions.definition: To wink.
To bate or flutter, as a hawk.
(usually with 'around' or 'about') To flit quickly from place to place.
definitions.example: I've spent all week batting around the country.

definitions.definition: A packsaddle.
The official currency of Thailand, equal to 100 satang.
A spider.
To obtain, to purchase (as in drugs), to get hold of, to take.
To (be forced to) take; to receive; to shoulder; to bear, especially blame or punishment for a particular instance of wrongdoing.
definitions.example: When caught, he would often cop a vicious blow from his father

definitions.definition: (trainspotting) To see and record a railway locomotive for the first time.
To steal.
To adopt.
To earn by bad behavior.
(usually with “to”) to admit, especially to a crime.
definitions.example: Harold copped to being known as "Dirty Harry".

definitions.definition: For a pimp to recruit a prostitute into the stable.
(law enforcement) A police officer or prison guard.
(crafts) The ball of thread wound on to the spindle in a spinning machine.
The top, summit, especially of a hill.
The crown (of the head); also the head itself.
definitions.example: The stature is bowed down in age, the cop is depressed.

definitions.definition: A tube or quill upon which silk is wound.
A merlon.
A woman who speaks as the voice of a group of people.
To become involved in a situation, so as to alter or prevent an action.
definitions.example: The police had to be called to intervene in the fight.

definitions.definition: To occur, fall, or come between, points of time, or events.
definitions.example: An instant intervened between the flash and the report.

definitions.definition: To occur or act as an obstacle or delay.
definitions.example: Nothing intervened to prevent the undertaking.

definitions.definition: To say (something) in the middle of a conversation or discussion between other people, or to respond to a situation involving other people.
To come between, or to be between, persons or things.
definitions.example: The Mediterranean intervenes between Europe and Africa.

definitions.definition: In a suit to which one has not been made a party, to put forward a defense of one's interest in the subject matter.
definitions.example: an application for leave (i.e. permission) to intervene

definitions.definition: One who counts
definitions.example: He's only 16 months, but is already a good counter – he can count to 100.

definitions.definition: A reckoner; someone who collects data by counting; an enumerator.
An object (now especially a small disc) used in counting or keeping count, or as a marker in games, etc.
definitions.example: He rolled a six on the dice, so moved his counter forward six spaces.

definitions.definition: A telltale; a contrivance attached to an engine, printing press, or other machine, for the purpose of counting the revolutions or the pulsations.
A variable, memory location, etc. whose contents are incremented to keep a count.
A hit counter.
A table or board on which money is counted and over which business is transacted
definitions.example: He put his money on the counter, and the shopkeeper put it in the till.

definitions.definition: A shop tabletop on which goods are examined, weighed or measured.
In a kitchen, a surface, often built into the wall and above a cabinet, designed to be used for food preparation.
In a bathroom, a surface, often built into the wall and above a cabinet, which holds the washbasin.
Any stone lying closer to the center than any of the opponent's stones.
The prison attached to a city court; a compter.

(grammar) A class of word used along with numbers to count objects and events, typically mass nouns. Although rare and optional in English (e.g. "20 head of cattle"), they are numerous and required in Chinese, Japanese, and Korean.
A deal to swap goods or services.
A conservative; originally tied to Nicaraguan counter-revolutionaries.
An entry (or account) that cancels another entry (or account).
definitions.example: The sum for each contra account is shown in the last column.

definitions.definition: Any of the musical instruments in the contrabass range, e.g. contrabassoon, contrabass clarinet or, especially, double bass.
A contra dance.
A country dance.
Something opposite or contrary to something else.
A proactive defensive hold or move in reaction to a hold or move by one's opponent.
definitions.example: Always know a counter to any hold you try against your opponent.

definitions.definition: The overhanging stern of a vessel above the waterline, below and somewhat forward of the stern proper.
The piece of a shoe or a boot around the heel of the foot (above the heel of the shoe/boot).
The breast of a horse; that part of a horse between the shoulders and under the neck.
The enclosed or partly closed negative space of a glyph.
An encounter.
To contradict, oppose.
To return a blow while receiving one, as in boxing.
To take action in response to; to respond.
To encounter.
Contrary or opposing
definitions.example: His carrying a knife was counter to my plan.

definitions.definition: Contrary, in opposition; in an opposite direction.
In the wrong way; contrary to the right course.
definitions.example: a hound that runs counter

definitions.definition: The act of joining, or the state of being joined.
A place where two things meet, especially where two roads meet.
The boundary between two physically different materials, especially between conductors, semiconductors, or metals.
The place where a distributary departs from the main stream.
A place where two or more railways or railroads meet.
A point in time between two unrelated consecutive broadcasts.
A kind of symbolic link to a directory.
In the Raku programming language, a construct representing a composite of several values connected by an operator.
(of roads or tracks) To form a junction.
In one way or another; in a way not yet known or explained; by some means
definitions.example: This problem has to be tackled somehow.

definitions.definition: Stucco or plaster applied to walls (mostly to outside masonry walls).
A digital image produced by rendering a model.
definitions.example: A low-resolution render might look blocky.

definitions.definition: A surrender.
A return; a payment of rent.
An account given; a statement.
(ditransitive) To cause to become.
definitions.example: The shot rendered her immobile.

definitions.definition: To interpret, give an interpretation or rendition of.
definitions.example: The pianist rendered the Beethoven sonata beautifully.

definitions.definition: To translate into another language.
definitions.example: to render Latin into English

definitions.definition: To pass down.
definitions.example: render a verdict (i.e., deliver a judgment)

definitions.definition: To make over as a return.
definitions.example: They had to render the estate.

definitions.definition: To give; to give back; to deliver.
definitions.example: render aid; render money

definitions.definition: To give up; to yield; to surrender.
To transform (a model) into a display on the screen or other media.
definitions.example: rendering images

definitions.definition: To capture and turn over to another country secretly and extrajudicially.
To convert waste animal tissue into a usable byproduct.
definitions.example: rendering of fat into soap

definitions.definition: To have fat drip off meat from cooking.
definitions.example: Bacon is very fatty when raw; however, most of the fat will render during cooking.

definitions.definition: To cover a wall with a layer of plaster.
definitions.example: to render with stucco

definitions.definition: To pass; to run; said of the passage of a rope through a block, eyelet, etc.
definitions.example: A rope renders well, that is, passes freely.

definitions.definition: To yield or give way.
To return; to pay back; to restore.
To inflict, as a retribution; to requite.
One who rends.
An opinion, a judgment, a surmise.
To judge, to pass judgment on; to doom, to sentence.
To adjudge, to decree.
To dispense (justice); to administer (law).
(ditransitive) To hold in belief or estimation; to adjudge as a conclusion; to regard as being; to evaluate according to one's beliefs; to account.
definitions.example: She deemed his efforts insufficient.

definitions.definition: To think, judge, or have or hold as an opinion; to decide or believe on consideration; to suppose.
The act of amassing or gathering, as into a pile.
The process of growing into a heap or a large amount.
definitions.example: an accumulation of earth, of sand, of evils, of wealth, or of honors

definitions.definition: A mass of something piled up or collected.
The concurrence of several titles to the same proof.
The continuous growth of capital by retention of interest or savings.
The action of investors buying an asset from other investors when the price of the asset is low.
The practice of taking two higher degrees simultaneously, to reduce the length of study.
An organized procession consisting of a series of consecutive displays, performances, exhibits, etc. displayed by moving down a street past a crowd of spectators.
definitions.example: The floats and horses in the parade were impressive, but the marching bands were really amazing.

definitions.definition: A procession of people moving down a street, organized to protest something.
Any succession, series, or display of items.
definitions.example: The dinner was a parade of courses, each featuring foods more elaborate than the last.

definitions.definition: A line of goslings led by one parent and often trailed by the other.
Pompous show; formal display or exhibition; outward show (as opposed to substance).
An assembling of troops for inspection or to receive orders.
Posture of defense; guard.
The ground where a military display is held, or where troops are drilled.
A public walk; a promenade; now used in street names.
definitions.example: He was parked on Chester Parade.

definitions.definition: (collective) (uncommon) A term of venery denoting a herd of elephants on the move.
To march in or as if in a procession.
definitions.example: They paraded around the field, simply to show their discipline.

definitions.definition: To cause (someone) to march in or as if in a procession; to display or show (something) during a procession.
definitions.example: They paraded dozens of fashions past the crowd.

definitions.definition: To exhibit in a showy or ostentatious manner.
To march past.
definitions.example: After the field show, it is customary to parade the stands before exiting the field.

definitions.definition: To march through or along; (of a vehicle) to move slowly through or along.
To assemble to receive orders.
To assemble (soldiers, sailors) for inspection, to receive orders, etc.
(of geese and other waterfowl) To march in a line led by one parent and often trailed by the other.
Any green, leafy plant, or parts thereof, used to flavour or season food.
A plant whose roots, leaves or seeds, etc. are used in medicine.
definitions.example: If any medicinal herbs used by witches were supposedly evil, then how come people from at least the past benefited from the healing properties of such herbs?

definitions.definition: Marijuana.
A plant whose stem is not woody and does not persist beyond each growing season
Grass; herbage.
(of time) To take or use.
To take or use space.
To have sexual intercourse with.
To do business in; to busy oneself with.
To use; to expend; to make use of.
Wanton or unrestrained behavior; uproar; tumult.
The tumultuous disturbance of the public peace by an unlawful assembly of three or more persons in the execution of some private object.
A wide and unconstrained variety.
definitions.example: In summer this flower garden is a riot of colour.

definitions.definition: Excessive and expensive feasting; wild and loose festivity; revelry.
To create or take part in a riot; to raise an uproar or sedition.
definitions.example: The nuclear protesters rioted outside the military base.

definitions.definition: To act in an unrestrained or wanton manner; to indulge in excess of feasting, luxury, etc.
To cause to riot; to throw into a tumult.
To annoy.
(diminutive) An odd number.
definitions.example: So let's see. There are two evens here and three odds.

definitions.definition: Something left over, not forming part of a set.
The ratio of the probability of an event happening to that of it not happening.
definitions.example: I'd say the odds are strongly in favor of the sun rising tomorrow morning.

definitions.definition: The ratio of winnings to stake in betting situations.
